org.dancres.blitz.jini.lockmgr
Interface MutualExclusion

All Known Implementing Classes:
Proxy
public interface MutualExclusion

Proxy interface for the locker service. Running more than one node in the same locker group provides fault-tolerance/resilience where locks and resources are replicated around the group.

Locks are stateless in that they are allocated on request and exist only as long as the lock is held ensuring that any other lock attempts are blocked until release.

However, one may associate a resource with a particular lock such that the resource is made available to a client which acquires the lock.

Basic usage is:

  1. Locate MutualExclusion instance
  2. Locate TransactionManager instance
  3. Use TransactionFactory to obtain transaction
  4. Request lock under transaction
  5. Perform work with appropriate services under transaction
  6. Commit transaction to make changes and release lock
  7. If something goes awry, abort the transaction to free the lock

getLock

public LockResult getLock(java.lang.String aClass,
                          java.lang.Comparable anId,
                          net.jini.core.transaction.Transaction aTxn,
                          java.io.Serializable anIdentifier)
                   throws java.rmi.RemoteException
Request a lock using the specified identifier. If there is a resource associated with the passed identifier, it will be made available to the caller if the lock is successfully acquired.

Parameters:
aClass - the class of the lock e.g. "entry" or "service" or whatever. This allows for logical grouping of locks which supports, for example, partitioning across or within applications.
anId - a unique identifier within the class for this lock
aTxn - the txn to associate the lock with. Lock will be held for as long as transaction is active and released at commit/abort.
anIdentifier - is a application level identifier that the caller may wish to associate with the lock - not yet supported
Returns:
LockResult indicating lock status
Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException
